snippet: The Guardian reports the company provided the National Security Agency with up-to-date access to its customer data whenever it changed its encryption and related technology.
abstract: Report in The Guardian finds that Microsoft has collaborated with National Security Agency more extensively than it previously acknowledged, providing agency with up-to-date access to its customer data whenever it changed its encryption and related software technology; report is based on disclosures by former NSA contractor Edward J Snowden.

byline.contributor: Claire Cain Miller contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: The Guardian reports the company provided the National Security Agency with up-to-date access to its customer data whenever it changed its encryption and related technology.

headline.main: Report Indicates More Extensive Cooperation by Microsoft on Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Report Indicates More Extensive Cooperation by Microsoft on Surveillance
